The more technology kids interact with, the more adults want to set some controls on that interaction. New options do abound. One of the latest from a company called FiLIP: a smartwatch that lets parents control who the kid calls, among other things. Ben Johnson talks to Lindsey Turrentine, editor in chief for reviews at CNET.

","type":"text/html"}]
description: This holiday season there are more kinds of gadgets for kids -- and many more ways for parents to control access.
contentencoded: The more technology kids interact with, the more adults want to set some controls on that interaction. New options do abound. One of the latest from a company called FiLIP: a smartwatch that lets parents control who the kid calls, among other things. Ben Johnson talks to Lindsey Turrentine, editor in chief for reviews at CNET.
title: With more gadgets, more parental controls
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Wednesday, December 4, 2013
teaser: This holiday season there are more kinds of gadgets for kids -- and many more ways for parents to control access.
